alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 28 at 9:21PM CDT until July 29 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN WHITESIDE...SOUTH CENTRAL CARROLL...SOUTHEASTERN JACKSON AND NORTHEASTERN CLINTON COUNTIES... At 921 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms capable of producing tornadoes were located along a line extending from Sabula to Clinton, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. These dangerous storms will be near... Fulton, Savanna, East Clinton and Thomson around 925 PM CDT. Garden Plain and Thomson Causeway around 930 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these tornadic storms include Argo Fay, Union Grove, Ustick, Fenton, Wacker, Center Hill, Ideal, Morrison, Fairhaven, Morrison-Rockwood State Park, Unionville, Whiteside County Fairgrounds and Franklin Corners. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
